DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the clinical performance of two daily disposable contact lenses.
DOC.brief_title: A Clinical Comparison of Two Daily Disposable Contact Lenses.
DOC.criteria: Age: 18 years to 45 years Current daily soft contact lens as habitual optical correction: Refraction: Best sphere (corrected for back vertex distance) 1.00 to 6.00D Cylinder 0.00 to 0.75D Best spectacle corrected visual acuity of 6/9 or better in each eye Willingness to adhere to the instructions set in the clinical protocol Signature of the subject on the informed consent form Systemic or ocular allergies which might interfere with contact lens wear Systemic disease which might interfere with contact lens wear Ocular disease which might interfere with contact lens wear (e.g. hypoesthesia, insufficient lacrimal secretion) Use of medication which might interfere with contact lens wear Active ocular infection Use of ocular medication Significant ocular anomaly Presence of two or more corneal scars in either eye Pregnancy or lactation Any medical condition that might be prejudicial to the study Participated in any other clinical studies in the past month Currently wears monovision
